entry.title: SMART READING SEEKING VOLUNTEERS TO HELP KIDS WITH READING
entry.summary: December 8, 2025 10:10 a.m. SMART Reading is seeking volunteers to help kids with reading during the current school year. Since 1992, SMART Reading has helped more than 334,000 Oregon children to build reading skills and a lifelong love of books. This year, SMART plans to serve over 1,300 students and give away more than...

entry.title: RESIDENTIAL LEAF PICKUPS CONTINUE THROUGH DECEMBER 31ST
entry.summary: December 8, 2025 9:50 a.m. Roseburg Public Works is offering leaf collection service through the end of December. A city release said Public Works crews follow a cyclical, systematic route to help residents with leaf disposal and provide an effective cost-controlled program that helps keep leaves out of storm drains, creeks and rivers. entry.title: CHRISTMAS TREE PERMITS STILL AVAILABLE FOR UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST
entry.summary: December 8, 2025 9:30 a.m. Christmas tree permits are still available for the Umpqua National Forest. entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 12.8.25
entry.summary: From Rogue Credit Union and Brooke Communications, our first wish is granted. Sally talks about the impact on her kids’ following her husbands drowning 5 years ago. Now help is needed as she wrecked one vehicle and the second one needs repairs to reliable. Help is on the way from Wish Upon A Star.

entry.title: 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights & Holiday Village
entry.summary: The 33rd Annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights at River Forks Park brings families together with thousands of displays, the Holiday Village, and the world’s largest nutcracker, all supporting Rotary’s 10,000 dollar annual student scholarship.

entry.title: OPTIMIST CLUB WITH SANTA HOTLINE ON TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 8, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Roseburg Optimist Club will have its Santa Hotline on Tuesday night. Kids can call and speak with Santa Claus from 6:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. The number to call is 440-4393. Parents should remember to only have kids call Santa on Tuesday and between those hours.

entry.title: MISSING GREEN WOMAN, LORI SHARMAN, FOUND DECEASED
entry.summary: Lori Sharman, the missing woman from Green, was found deceased Thursday morning by Douglas County Search and Rescue. Deputies confirmed her death, and no foul play is suspected. Authorities extend their condolences to her family.

entry.title: Students share the importance of education
entry.summary: American Education Week has been celebrated during the third week of November since 1921. This annual recognition honors the contributions of everyone involved in education and raises awareness of the vital role public schools play in shaping communities.

entry.title: No Tax Oregon referendum petition passes 180,000 signatures. What comes next?
entry.summary: Oregon’s Legislature passed House Bill 3991 in September, a prospect that brought relief to ongoing concerns about the Oregon Department of Transportation’s (ODOT) capability to maintain its operations at the cost of increased taxes and fees for citizens.

entry.title: Sutherlin, Oakland FFA chapters place at state competitions
entry.summary: On Nov. 22, the state Food Science and Ag Sales competitions took place at Eastern Oregon University. The Sutherlin FFA Chapter competed in the Food Science Career Development Event (CDE) and placed second in state.
